results.title: Royal Australian Artillery
results.brief_description: The artillery man of today has accurate and efficient guns, unlike the men who manned the guns used to defend the colony of Sydney last century. This film describes the work and equipment of modern artillery-men in peace and wartime.

results.title: Royal Australian Army Service Corps
results.creator_credit: Department of Army, Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Service Corps, which ranges from the cold stores of Victoria to the Malaya jungle. Presents interesting features such as air-drops in Malaya and the provisioning of Antarctic bases, using landing craft.

results.title: Royal Air Force police dog training
results.creator_credit: William Hammond, William Weedon and British Films
results.brief_description: Dogs can be invaluable for guarding aeroplanes, supplies and prisoners, and realising this, the RAF set up a Police Dog Training Centre. This film shows each stage in the training of one of these dogs.

results.title: Roy Orbison and friends: a black and white night
results.brief_description: Rob Orbison and his special guests took to the stage at the legendary Coconut Grove ballroom in Los Angeles on September 30, 1987. Joined by Bruce Springsteen, Elvis Costello, Tom Waits, Jackson Brown, Steve Soles, J.D. Souther, Bonnie Raitt, K.D. Laing and Jennifer Warnes, and backed by an all star band, Roy performed his legendary classics, including “Only the Lonely” and “Oh, Pretty Woman”, as well as a few new ones in a spellbinding hour of entertainment.

results.title: Roy Lichtenstein
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Haydon, Barrie Gavin, Julia Cave and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Presents Roy Lichtenstein at work in his studio and indicates the sources of his inspiration and his artistic philosophies. Covers the development of his work from the sixties onwards. Photography by Fintan Sheehan. Sound by John Tellick and Tony Anscombe. Edited by Ben Morris Rostrum. Cinematography by Ken Morse.

results.title: Roy Lichtenstein
results.brief_description: Featuring a rare and lengthy interview with Roy Lichtenstein discussing his work, past and present, and his career, this documentary offers a comprehensive insight into one of the pioneers of Pop Art in the United States. The program documents the rise to record prices of Lichtenstein’s work and his steadily built reputation as one of the world’s foremost contemporary artists for the breadth and depth of his paintings. The impact of his work, its critical status in the contemporary art world and his contribution to the pop art movement are all discussed through the interviews with Lichtenstein himself as he is seen working on paintings in his studio in New York. Such notions are also approached through interviews with long-time supporters, gallery owners and curators and art critics to provide a thorough study of the man and his work.

results.title: Roy Hollsdotter live
results.creator_credit: Matthew Saville, Trevor Blainey, Film Victoria, Australian Film Commission and Retro Active Films
results.brief_description: After being ditched by his girlfriend, misanthropic stand-up comedian Roy Hollsdotter lapses into a downward spiral of self-loathing, hitting the self destruct button at every turn. Despite the appeals of best friend Simmo to get over it, Roy continues on his antagonistic journey swiping mercilessly at all who have the misfortune to cross his path. Filmed in The Esplanade’s Gershwin Room, this black comedy is a searing portrait of a man at war with himself. Stars real-life stand up comedian Darren Casey in the title role. This disc also contains amusing early shorts by Matthew Saville.

results.title: Roxanne
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Daniel Melnick, Michael Rachmil and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A modern version of the Cyranno De Bergerac story starring Steve Martin and Daryl Hannah, directed by Fred Schepisi. Small town fire chief C.D. Bales falls in love with a new arrival to the town; an astronomer called Roxanne. He possesses a large nose which stands in the way of his attaining happiness, but eventually true love triumphs in this heartwarming tale.

results.title: Rowing: a symphony of motion
results.creator_credit: Jerry Murphy, Trin Yarborough and Docufilms
results.brief_description: Surveys the different varieties of rowing from the grace and solitude of the single oarsman to the drive and precision of an eight-oar crew - a parallel of fragile beauty and driving power. Also includes a segment on women in rowing.

results.title: Rowing technique
results.creator_credit: Michael Johns, Elizabeth Isaacs and Dan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rowing and Sculling”.
This is a technical film for coaches and oarsmen. The full power of the oarsman’s body must be applied to the car and the correct movement and coordination achieved to give maximum power and efficiency. The importance of even rhythm and timing is stressed.
